column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Na2IrO3 were synthesized by solid state synthesis.

#Text=The starting materials Na2CO3 (99.995% Alfa Aesar) and anhydrous IrO2 (\ 99.95% KaiDa) were mixed in the ratio 1.05 : 1 and placed in an alumina crucible with a lid and heated to 750 ◦C in 5 hrs and held there for 24 hrs after which it was fur- nace cooled to room temperature.
#Text=The resulting mixture was ground and pelletized, placed in an alumina crucible and heated to 900 ◦C in 6 hrs and held there for 48 hrs before cooling to room temperature.
#Text=The pellet was re- ground and pelletized and the above heat treatment was repeated at 950 ◦C for 48 hrs.
#Text=The resulting hard, well sintered pellet is black in color and is stable in air for months.
#Text=Part of the pellet was crushed for powder x-ray diffraction (XRD).
#Text=The XRD patterns were obtained at room temperature using a Rigaku Geigerflex diffractome- ter with Cu K radiation, in the 2\ range from 10 to 90◦ with a 0.02◦ step size.
#Text=Intensity data were accumulated for 5 s per step.
#Text=Dc electrical transport was measured on a home built setup using the four probe technique.

#Text=The isothermal magnetization M(H), static magnetic susceptibility \(T ), and dynamic magnetic susceptibility \ac(T ) were measured using a commercial Superconduct- ing Quantum Interference Device (SQUID) magnetome- ter (MPMS5, Quantum Design) and the heat capacity C(T ) was measured using a commercial Physical Prop- erty Measurement System (PPMS5, Quantum Design).
